(46) 148)30th December, 1946CABINETDEFENCE committee note by the Prime Minister1. In conformity with the policy announced in the White Paper on central organisation for Defence (Cmd. 6923), the Defence Committee will be recon-stituted as from 1st January, 1947.2. The membership of the Committee will be : Prime Minister (Chairm.an).Minister of T)eienc&*.( Deputy Chairman).Lord President of the Council.Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs.Chancellor of the Exchequer.Minister of Labour and National Service.First Lord of the Admiralty.Secretary of State for War.Secretary of State for Air.Minister of Supply.2 Other Ministers will be invited to attend meetings at which questionsI affecting their Departments are to be discussed. The Chiefs of Staff will be in\ attendance. Other officers and Departmental officials will be summoned to attendI as required.3. The terms of reference of the Committee will be : *(a) To handle current defence problems.\b) To co-ordinate departmental action and plans in preparation for war.4. The secretariat of the Committee will be : Joint Secretaries: Lieut.-General Sir Leslie C. Hollis.Mr. W. S. Murrie.Senior Assistant Secretary (Military) : Brigadier A. T. Cornwall-Jones.C. R. A.
